newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish shares firm 0.90 pct on selective buys.
newsitem.headline: Turkish shares firm 0.90 pct on selective buys.

text.p: Istanbul shares firmed on selective buying led by shares of largely state-owned firms on Tuesday, but volume dropped and trade remained range-bound, brokers said.
The IMKB-100 closed at 81,894.64, up 723.38 points, or 0.89 percent from Monday when it lost 1.69 percent. It moved between 80,787-81,885 during the day.
Trade volume dived to 16.73 trillion lira ($172 million) from Monday's 21.64 trillion ($223.4 million).
"The index looks settled at these levels and the market is in a sideways trend because most shares carry premiums and are not suitable to buy," said Murat Iman from Ata securities.
"There was activity only in state shares due to privatisation expectations and in a few others with comparatively low prices," he added.

Brokers were expecting range-bound trade this week between 81,000 and 84,000 after the index failed to pierce the critical 85,000 barrier last Thursday. Major support is seen at 80,000 if 81,000 is broken.
The index had surged 29.3 percent from September 13 to an all-time high close of 83,772.33 on October 23, the tenth record in an uptrend which began with the breaching of 65,000 level.
